name: Ancient Philosophy
long_desc: This course will cover Ancient Greek philosophy from the preSocratics to the later Hellenistic writers. We will prepare the background for Socrates and Plato by studying major Presocratic philosophers such as the Milesians, Heraclitus, and Parmenides, and then dive in to a careful study of some of the central works of Plato and Aristotle. A key theme of the class will be the way in which Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle sought to define philosophy in opposition to sophistry, and how the lessons learned from their confrontation with sophistry informed their ethical and metaphysical thought. The final sections will discuss postAristotelian movements such as Epicureanism, Skepticism, and Stoicism.

custom_fields.goals: Understand the origins and development of Ancient Greek Philosophy, how it distinguished itself from Sophistry, and how it generated debates and questions that still continue
custom_fields.key_topics: Presocratic Philosophy, Philosophy vs. Sophistry, Socrates, Plato, Aristotle, Stoicism
custom_fields.learning_resources: Books, texts posted to canvas, etc.
